intro: Descurainia cleefii, commonly known as Cleef's tansy. It is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family, native to arid regions of Central Asia. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in dry environments. Descurainia cleefii is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is considered a rare species.
